Les Suites Orient Bund Shanghai
8.9 Excellent
Based on 2270 reviews

Booking this hotel literally saved me in a couple different ways. I'd like to note that I only stayed in Shanghai a night due to a long layover, and didn't do much research ahead of time on the area since I was staying such a short time and intended to just explore and find things.

First of all, the hotel itself was absolutely gorgeous. I've never seen a hotel so beautiful and it was located directly on the main street of the Bund just a short walk away from the river. I booked a room with a Bund view and it was stunning. Definitely the highlight of my short visit. Additionally, I was upgraded to a deluxe room with a living area, comfortable king size bed, and chic bathroom complete with shower, and a tub with a view of the Bund. Everything was clean and very updated, the toilet even had a heated seat! All of the halls and other rooms of the hotel featured relics in glass cases, extravagant furnishings and decor. I visited the 24 hour lounge and got a cup of expresso and a few biscuits, all complimentary, while I enjoyed comfortable seating, lots of magazines to choose from, and of course the lovely view. Now onto how they saved me - I had planned to make the most of my night in Shanghai by exploring the area downtown, grabbing dinner somewhere that caught my fancy, and stopping in whatever drink places I came across. However, at 11pm all of the lights of the buildings on the Bund turned off. If I had done more research ahead of time I would have probably known this. I walked around anyway, along the riverside and saw the bull statue. But I had no luck finding late night food options, and after walking many side streets for a couple hours was only able to find one cocktail bar that was open and welcoming. It was about 1am and honestly I started to feel a bit unsafe, which I wasn't expecting in a big city so close to the downtown, touristy area. I was disappointed. So, I called it a night and went back to my hotel. Along the way I tried to stop at a couple convenie

Show more
Lindsey , United States
SSAW Boutique Hotel Shanghai Bund
8.4 Excellent
Based on 5122 reviews

We arrived late our first night and were met with a very nice, gracious employee. He was just as nice on our last day when we were checking out.

Our suite was amazing. Unlike other hotel rooms that we've had in Asia, the bed was spacious and super comfortable, so much so that we ended up sleeping a lot. The Wifi, air conditioning, and heating all worked perfectly! The shower water pressure and temperature were great. The hotel makes it a point to say that everything in the minibar is free, and there is a free social time between 10 p.m. and midnight. That said, beyond the bottled waters and a few sodas, there isn't really a lot in the minibar, and we never understood what the social time was supposed to be since every time we went, there wasn't much food or anything to select from. We still very much appreciated the bottled water and sodas and thought that the hotel was excellent. Beyond that, the location was also quite good. It is about 1 block from one metro stop and about 5 minutes from another metro stop, so generally you could get to any tourist site within 10-15 minutes via metro. We wish we could take this hotel with us everywhere!!!!!

Show more
Elaine , United States
Central Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 870 reviews

Room was beautiful, awesome views from my room at least, and in the middle of the main tourist drag. Peoples Square is near along with many places of interest.

Eateries galore within 2-3 blocks. Hotel staff was friendly, They permitted me to change rooms twice during the 14 night stay at my request. Now on to the negatives. Wifi was nearly not usable, constantly dropping and requiring a resign on process, but a Lan connection was provided. The cooling system was cool enough, in fact a bit too cool. Had to turn the A/C off because a tad cold on a summer's night. The building is in dire need of a new water system. Taking a shower could suddenly turn ice cold or very hot. At times seems not to get hot enough, water pressure on the low side. It seems as if another guest flushes the toilet, the water would get very hot, and vice versa, if another guest was using hot water, your shower will run cold. The dining room could be run better - very confusing was more than one restaurant but the same central welcome staff - couldn't find my reservation. Despite these issues, I will book this hotel again - I hope they correct the problems. Who knows, maybe it will then deserve a full 5 stars.

Show more
Calvin , United States
Grand Central Hotel Shanghai
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1432 reviews

The only good thing from this hotel is the location. Everything else from here on is a horrible performance by the hotel management.

- Arrived at 4pm and told room was not ready. Had to wait another hour. - Wifi was weak in the room. When i finally got connected, the speed was awfully slow. Took minutes to even load a news page? - Even with the connected lan cable to my computer, the speed was horrendously slow. I couldn't load a page without having to refresh. - There was attempted phishing with a fake "Grand centralhotel Shanghai" SSID. I connected it in haste and saw some attempts with tempering of my email. Luckily it was the non-important email. - Check out took 45 mins of q-ing!!!!!! Despite the long queue, they only had 2 counters open with many other staff standing around using their phones and totally un-interested in speeding up the process - The breakfast is expensive at RMB185 (after taxes) and the food is horrible. Pretty much tasteless. - The same lounge i had club sandwich and was served cold, even the fries were cold. Made a complain to the waiter but was brushed off as "i can't do anything. This is how it is prepared" Overall a horrible experience at this hotel. Never ever ever stay in this hotel again. Sofitel Hotel which is just across may be a much better choice.

Show more
Alvin , Singapore
Guxiang Hotel Shanghai
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1564 reviews

This hotel has outlived its status as 5-star. The rooms are tired and over-furnished (making them crowded) with outdated facilities and poor standard amenities.

I seriously doubt the room met the size as advertised. I stood on carpet nails near where the aged carpet met the foyer tiles - fortunately not breaking skin. I had to use fingernails to lift the bath plug in order to have a shower that drained. The shower head spewed an uncomfortable stream of water in a small showering space (in the bath - not a separate shower stall). The bathroom amenities are of a poor quality. The whole room experience reeks of owners who can't be bothered updating the hotel in order to make for a decent guest experience. Staff also failed to meet the Howard Johnson claim of exceeding expectations. Concierge shrugged when I requested an umbrella (it was raining), cafe staff stared into space instead watching guests to anticipate their needs, and Sunday morning checkout had one guest services agent operating until a massive line built up. The only positive I can offer for this hotel is its location. I am sure there are better value, better service options nearby.

Show more
Gavin , Australia
Grand Kempinski Hotel Shanghai
8.4 Excellent
Based on 382 reviews

It was a great stay experience, though short stay. I arrived early in the morning but the hotel staff was kind enough to extend me an available room for early check-in, with reasonable upgrade fee.

The paramount moment i experienced is when I asked for help on retrieving what I forgot in the room. It was something I cannot replace with monetary value, but was too late to head back to hotel, as I was about to depart to my next destination by air. However the hotel staff was attentive to coordinate the goods hand over to my local associate. The only point I really regret is that not many people recognizes the location or the name of the hotel. All my taxi drivers could not figure out the location even if I hand out the map, address etc. Some tourist maps, such as maps on major location, online maps, do not seem to be updated and do not display the current name of the hotel.

Show more
Sotaro , Japan
The Longemont Shanghai Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 477 reviews

The hotel's hospitality is outstanding. They remember the past requests I made and setup everything as I requested (in the past).

I have never had such experience with other famous five-star hotels worldwide. The room is gorgeous, nice and clean. China hotels usually have a lot of water related issues, but I never had any issues at all. High floor view is amazing always at night while chill-down with friends. You could sleep completely with relaxing room and comfortable bed. Breakfast has a lot of choices from both western and Chinese. The one thing bad about is a lack of transportaion (ie. Taxi) at evening. But, you will face as same situation as other hotels in Shanghai. Subway station for Line 2 is approx 10 min away.

Show more
YUKIYASU , Japan
Fraser Residence Shanghai
8.5 Excellent
Based on 805 reviews

I stayed in Fraser for about four Nights and the experience was great. The rooms were huge and it had everything that I needed .

They don't have a breakfast spread buffet but we get to choose a meal of our choice which is still decent and good enough to fill me up. That aside, the hotel is great. One of the night, I encountered some problems in the hotel room which I shared with the staff, Angel the next morning. She was attentive, patient and went the extra mile in showing me other rooms that were available. With all smiles at all times, she switch the room for me. Impeccable service from her. Also during our stay, we often have to find our ways to certain location. Jason who attended to us often was patient and explained to us the directions, which station to take and alight. He was also often seen at the lobby helping guests managing their luggage and handling the pick up. Both Angel and Jason definitely deserve a compliment from Fraser. I also wished to thank both especially Angel for making my stay comfortable.

Show more
Chloe , Singapore
Fairmont Peace Hotel
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 359 reviews

what a spectacular hotel! its history is enough to sell the hotel, but add to this its excellent location (junction of the bund waterfront and nanjing dong lu retail strip), beautiful art-deco/colonial interior design, and very friendly staff, you will be a fantastic hotel.

even though my room (definitely the cheapest one in the hotel) faces a courtyard, the room is incredibly spacious with its own walk-in wardrobe, passage way, alcove with study desk, large 3-seater sofa, and a white/black marble bathroom (with 2 sinks, a shower stall and claw-foot bath tub, with its personal tv). yet in this lofty hotel, the staff are incredibly personal and friendly! from evida (the smiley receptionist) to mimi (the friendly pool attendant) to eddy (the efficient and professional head waiter at cathay room) to the many room attendants, everybody showed passion and dedication! there are more glitzy hotels in shanghai (e.g. peninsula and waldorf astoria are more bright, shiny and gleamingly beautiful), but the peace is a historical institution that must be experienced. the only minor 'down' sides are: (a) no tea bags in the room (although there is a nespresso-like coffee machine); (b) rather plain swimming pool (very efficient 18 metre pool, but relatively unadorned environment); (c) limited photography permitted in the lobby. nevertheless, the negatives pale to the incredible positives of this charmed hotel!

Show more
Tou , Singapore
The Bund Riverside Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 1845 reviews

When booking the hotel the photo of hotel looked like it stood out from high rise buildings , not the case it's been cleverly redone in Photoshop.

It stands in between high buildings . The entrance to hotel is up some steep steps off the street and the porters are very helpful and also the reception staff . When we go to our room on first appearance looked very good , you could tell it had been cleaned and made ready for us. However the bed was quite hard , the wallpaper was shabby and looked a bit dated . The seems in Paper coming apart . Air conditioning was a bit up and down on if it blew cold air at all. The headboard behind bed was stained and could do with a steam clean. Bathroom was well laid out and the hot water was Luke warm the first day then after running water for a while did eventually get hot . The maid was excellent and cleaned the room brilliantly. Downstairs in the first bar by reception , the chairs were all worn and looked like been got out of a skip. The outside windows looked like never been cleaned and had stains inside and out. Steps into hotel were cleaned with a broom , really should have been washed down properly . Really I would give this a 10 out of 10 for location . But the rest would be a 7 out of 10 It's not a bad place but could do with just a bit more effort on the above points then could be 8 easily ! This is not a put down but just some basic facts that need addressing to make it a really great place .

Show more
Wayne , United Kingdom
Da Zhong Pudong Airport Hotel Shanghai
7.1 Very good
Based on 1844 reviews

When I arrived this airport hotel after the midnight, I saw all staffs sleeping behind reception counter.

.. it was almost comical to observe it. As you can imagine, none of them spoke decent English despite the fact the hotel is located within the international airport. When I checked into my room, there was a laminated card entitled "important notice", marked that the hotel is under the renovation that electricity will be shut (thus no hot water, heating, etc) from 7a.m. til 6 p.m. I called the front desk immediately from my room phone to check whether this is true or not. The front desk immidiately put me thru on hold as she does not understand English, and forwarded my call to the room service. The room service put me on hold and forwarded my call back to the front desk. They did this forwarding battle 3-4 times until I hanged up the phone. Of course, electricity cut never happened and no renovation whatsoever was not happening in the hotel. Maybe the hotel is a part of the Saturday Night Live set or the Fawlty Towers in the real life. Highly recommended if you want to experience a real drama after tiring red-eye flight.

Show more
Itsuki , Japan
Dorsett Shanghai @ Century Park
7.9 Very good
Based on 1867 reviews

The staff at the Dorsett are excellent. The location, right on top of the metro station is perfect. Then you have Century park directly across the street.

All and all its an optimal spot. They also have a family mart and a grocery store within 1 minute walk The only negatives for the hotel are the buffett, which has been going down hill for the past 3 years. Also it needs some upgrades. No work has been done in past 3 years. Also unless you are willing to go out to eat a local restaurants ( the street behind has dozens including a Xinjiang restaurant that is excellent Overall the price compared to the Kerry or others in the area is excellent. In terms of value for money likely one of the best hotels in Pudong.

Show more
Jason , Canada
Hotel Pravo All Suites @ North Bund
8.3 Excellent
Based on 744 reviews

This hotel is TOO DARK! From the lobby to the corridors and from the breakfast buffet area to the room, this place is really DARK! Not enough light at all inside the room! I don't know how anyone can work at night.

Sure, during the day it is alright, but at night. Golly, it's like I'm dealing with a moody room! As a result, everytime I stepped into the hotel I felt a sickly feeling come over me because of the lack of light. More light, PLEASE!!! Air conditioning was not as cold as I wanted it to be. The toilet is remote controlled. Yes, it will also regulate seat temperature! Cool! I mean, the seat was a toasty temperature everytime I sat down! Nice! HOWEVER, I can just imagine the cleanliness of that toilet remote. I Lysol'ed the begeezus out of that thing. Was expecting a nice big view of the Shanghai skyline, but was a bit disappointed. Sure, you could see part of the city from an awkward angle. Area is kinda quiet, and a bit far from the main Bund area. Don't expect a 5 minute walk. More like 15 minutes. However, Shanghai's cabs are cheap and easy to come by. Flag one down and save your feet the trouble with a 15 yuan (~$3) fare. I have to say, though, during this particular business trip, I ate at various hotel breakfast buffets including Fraser Hotels, Hyatt, Fairmont, Raffles, etc. This hotel, BY FAR, had the best french toast! There was a sweet butter INSIDE the french toast. Delicious.

Show more
Miguel , Philippines
Majesty Plaza Shanghai Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 928 reviews

Overall stay was pleasant, everything in the room works except wifi, the signal in room was weak and unstable but very strong outside the room along the corridor so we spent a fair bit of time standing outside.

Maybe it is common among Shanghainese, their service staff are seriously lacking in service standard. Including the staff in the hotel, as if it will cost them if they were to smile a bit more. Another observation is there were no seats in the lobby so if you are waiting for friends/family you need to stand around. Some people even resort to sitting on steps in the lobby which was unsightly. Just step out of the back entrance of the hotel and you are at Nanjing Road Pedestrian Street, where all the action is day and night. Directly opposite of hotel is Shanghai First Foodhall where you can find good eats from 2nd to 4th floor. This hotel is really only 4-star, not 5 as they claimed.

Show more
Evelyn , Singapore
Sofitel Shanghai Hyland Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 1477 reviews

It was merely 1 minute walk to Metro entrance. The back entrance leads to the busy and action-filled Nanjing East walking mall.

Fantastic spot for food and shop. Just another 500 meters or 15 mins walk, you have the Bund right under your eyes. The abundance of different eateries and other shopping centers around the hotel making selection another headache. We were giving 21st floor that offered a splendid view of the Shanghai skyline and the walking mall below. All the facilities in the room are working well. The housekeeping done a good job to ensue our room was sparkling clean and tidy. They even leaf an UMBRELLA in the room as there were drizzling What a thoughtful way to ensure the guests were dry while out strolling.. Again, the air condition could not provide the cold temperature we desire but was comfortable. Seem this happened to many hotels. I appreciate the hotel's compliment of the birthday cake for my special day and received a signed greeting card from the GM. THANK YOU. The concierge was so knowledgeable and efficient. Spare no effort to ensure we get to our destination correctly and inquires were checked and reaffirmed with a note pad!! Even giving us some alternative to choose should we decide other options in that destination. Wonder service and Great job done. It is a misleading rating by Agoda for Sofitel as a 5-stars hotel. At the entrance of the hotel it stated as "4-stars" hotel. Thus the price could be lower to reflecting its current rating. Overall, I love to stay in this hotel.

Show more
Oliver , Malaysia
Andaz Xintiandi Shanghai-a concept by Hyatt
8.8 Excellent
Based on 277 reviews

this is a brand new hotel located right by xtd where there're lots of food and shopping. we had a three year old with us and it was a pleasant stay.

everything in the fridge was complimentary, there's a snack bar in the lobby that serves free drinks and snack at all time. the breakfast was very delicious, unfortunately our package did not include it. their onion soup is excellent. the room was quite spacious but make sure you face the xtd side for a better view (all queen/king size beds face that way). the building structure is almost identical to the langham next door, with the same price, langham appear to be at a higher end compare to the andaz. andaz appear to be more of a trendy, younger style hotel. we had a slight problem on day 1, the tub water was constantly providing yellow/dirt water, but the staff managed to fix it within the hour and provided a dessert as an apology.

Show more
shu , United States
Swissotel Grand Shanghai
8.4 Excellent
Based on 630 reviews

A friend and I stayed here for its proximity to a venue we were visiting. It is perfectly positioned for shopping, dining or visiting the Jing'an Temple.

The room was very nice with comfortable beds and some of the most effective blackout curtains I've ever encountered. Our toilet kept running, but they were able to fix that after 2 attempts. We had dinner in their 2nd floor restaurant because I wanted authentic Swiss fondue. The salads we ordered were excellent, but the bar service took longer than it should have. The fondue also was not particularly tasty and I was disappointed that they didn't have fondue forks. When I returned home, I realised that I had left a pair of trousers in the room, so I called the hotel to see what could be done. Two days later, my clothes were mailed to me! Thank you so much!! I will definitely stay here again!

Show more
Ellen , United States
Banyan Tree Shanghai On The Bund
8.6 Excellent
Based on 188 reviews

The hotel itself was perfect - the room was amazingly decorated, the gym was great, 3 jacuzzis with different temperatures (however there was a weird noise in the background, probably of the water pumps that was pretty annoying).

Check in process was very guest-friendly, sitting, and being served mango juice and biscuits and a hot wet towel. Only problem was location - the hotel is totally in the middle of nowhere. This is one of a row of hotels on the part of West Nanjing Road that forms the north side of People's Square, and it is immediately opposite an entrance to a Metro station serving three Metro lines.

More about Shanghai

Shanghai was once just a humble fishing village at the mouth of the Yangtze River, but today it is one of China's biggest cities, and among the largest cities in the world. A sprawling and progressive metropolis with a proud and resplendent past, Shanghai is an epicenter of art and culture as well as commerce.

The city is served by Shanghai Pudong International Airport, which is conveniently located near a variety of hotels. There’s a great deal to see and do in Shanghai, one of which is the famous Oriental Pearl Tower. Those interested in learned more about the history of this region will find Qibao Historical Town to be a great destination.

China celebrates numerous festivals throughout the year, and Shanghai is definitely at the center of most of them. Travelers who want to experience these stunning displays of Chinese arts and culture are well advised to plan their arrival accordingly. Of course traveling to this region during the Chinese New year will be a special challenge, as everything will be at heightened state of excitement and chaos.

Getting around Shanghai is easy and affordable as options include the Shanghai metro and affordable taxis. When traveling through the older parts of the city, the best option would be to travel on foot.

Shanghai is a dazzling city with an exciting mix of the old and new in one of the most populated regions in the world.

There’s much more to see and learn about Shanghai, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.

LinkPoints Programme Qatar Airways Privilege Club reward-U Royal Skies Singapore Airlines KrisFlyer SkyPearl Club SM Advantage/ BDO Rewards Thai Airways Royal Orchid Plus The 1 Card Thailand TudoAzul United MileagePlus Velocity Frequent Flyer WAON POINT Featured Hotels Hotel Resort Guest House Apartment Villa Les Suites Orient Bund Shanghai 8.9 Excellent Based on 2270 reviews Booking this hotel literally saved me in a couple different ways. I'd like to note that I only stayed in Shanghai a night due to a long layover, and didn't do much research ahead of time on the area since I was staying such a short time and intended to just explore and find things. First of all, the hotel itself was absolutely gorgeous. I've never seen a hotel so beautiful and it was located directly on the main street of the Bund just a short walk away from the river. I booked a room with a Bund view and it was stunning. Definitely the highlight of my short visit. Additionally, I was upgraded to a deluxe room with a living area, comfortable king size bed, and chic bathroom complete with shower, and a tub with a view of the Bund. Everything was clean and very updated, the toilet even had a heated seat! All of the halls and other rooms of the hotel featured relics in glass cases, extravagant furnishings and decor. I visited the 24 hour lounge and got a cup of expresso and a few biscuits, all complimentary, while I enjoyed comfortable seating, lots of magazines to choose from, and of course the lovely view. Now onto how they saved me - I had planned to make the most of my night in Shanghai by exploring the area downtown, grabbing dinner somewhere that caught my fancy, and stopping in whatever drink places I came across. However, at 11pm all of the lights of the buildings on the Bund turned off. If I had done more research ahead of time I would have probably known this. I walked around anyway, along the riverside and saw the bull statue. But I had no luck finding late night food options, and after walking many side streets for a couple hours was only able to find one cocktail bar that was open and welcoming. It was about 1am and honestly I started to feel a bit unsafe, which I wasn't expecting in a big city so close to the downtown, touristy area. I was disappointed. So, I called it a night and went back to my hotel. Along the way I tried to stop at a couple convenie Show more Lindsey , United States SSAW Boutique Hotel Shanghai Bund 8.4 Excellent Based on 5122 reviews We arrived late our first night and were met with a very nice, gracious employee. He was just as nice on our last day when we were checking out. Our suite was amazing. Unlike other hotel rooms that we've had in Asia, the bed was spacious and super comfortable, so much so that we ended up sleeping a lot. The Wifi, air conditioning, and heating all worked perfectly! The shower water pressure and temperature were great. The hotel makes it a point to say that everything in the minibar is free, and there is a free social time between 10 p.m. and midnight. That said, beyond the bottled waters and a few sodas, there isn't really a lot in the minibar, and we never understood what the social time was supposed to be since every time we went, there wasn't much food or anything to select from. We still very much appreciated the bottled water and sodas and thought that the hotel was excellent. Beyond that, the location was also quite good. It is about 1 block from one metro stop and about 5 minutes from another metro stop, so generally you could get to any tourist site within 10-15 minutes via metro. We wish we could take this hotel with us everywhere!!!!! Show more Elaine , United States Central Hotel 8.4 Excellent Based on 870 reviews Room was beautiful, awesome views from my room at least, and in the middle of the main tourist drag. Peoples Square is near along with many places of interest. Eateries galore within 2-3 blocks. Hotel staff was friendly, They permitted me to change rooms twice during the 14 night stay at my request. Now on to the negatives. Wifi was nearly not usable, constantly dropping and requiring a resign on process, but a Lan connection was provided. The cooling system was cool enough, in fact a bit too cool. Had to turn the A/C off because a tad cold on a summer's night. The building is in dire need of a new water system. Taking a shower could suddenly turn ice cold or very hot. At times seems not to get hot enough, water pressure on the low side. It seems as if another guest flushes the toilet, the water would get very hot, and vice versa, if another guest was using hot water, your shower will run cold. The dining room could be run better - very confusing was more than one restaurant but the same central welcome staff - couldn't find my reservation. Despite these issues, I will book this hotel again - I hope they correct the problems. Who knows, maybe it will then deserve a full 5 stars. Show more Calvin , United States Grand Central Hotel Shanghai 8.8 Excellent Based on 1432 reviews The only good thing from this hotel is the location. Everything else from here on is a horrible performance by the hotel management. - Arrived at 4pm and told room was not ready. Had to wait another hour. - Wifi was weak in the room. When i finally got connected, the speed was awfully slow. Took minutes to even load a news page? - Even with the connected lan cable to my computer, the speed was horrendously slow. I couldn't load a page without having to refresh. - There was attempted phishing with a fake "Grand centralhotel Shanghai" SSID. I connected it in haste and saw some attempts with tempering of my email. Luckily it was the non-important email. - Check out took 45 mins of q-ing!!!!!! Despite the long queue, they only had 2 counters open with many other staff standing around using their phones and totally un-interested in speeding up the process - The breakfast is expensive at RMB185 (after taxes) and the food is horrible. Pretty much tasteless. - The same lounge i had club sandwich and was served cold, even the fries were cold. Made a complain to the waiter but was brushed off as "i can't do anything. This is how it is prepared" Overall a horrible experience at this hotel. Never ever ever stay in this hotel again. Sofitel Hotel which is just across may be a much better choice. Show more Alvin , Singapore Guxiang Hotel Shanghai 8.3 Excellent Based on 1564 reviews This hotel has outlived its status as 5-star. The rooms are tired and over-furnished (making them crowded) with outdated facilities and poor standard amenities. I seriously doubt the room met the size as advertised. I stood on carpet nails near where the aged carpet met the foyer tiles - fortunately not breaking skin. I had to use fingernails to lift the bath plug in order to have a shower that drained. The shower head spewed an uncomfortable stream of water in a small showering space (in the bath - not a separate shower stall). The bathroom amenities are of a poor quality. The whole room experience reeks of owners who can't be bothered updating the hotel in order to make for a decent guest experience. Staff also failed to meet the Howard Johnson claim of exceeding expectations. Concierge shrugged when I requested an umbrella (it was raining), cafe staff stared into space instead watching guests to anticipate their needs, and Sunday morning checkout had one guest services agent operating until a massive line built up. The only positive I can offer for this hotel is its location. I am sure there are better value, better service options nearby. Show more Gavin , Australia Grand Kempinski Hotel Shanghai 8.4 Excellent Based on 382 reviews It was a great stay experience, though short stay. I arrived early in the morning but the hotel staff was kind enough to extend me an available room for early check-in, with reasonable upgrade fee. The paramount moment i experienced is when I asked for help on retrieving what I forgot in the room. A sprawling and progressive metropolis with a proud and resplendent past, Shanghai is an epicenter of art and culture as well as commerce. The city is served by Shanghai Pudong International Airport , which is conveniently located near a variety of hotels. There’s a great deal to see and do in Shanghai, one of which is the famous Oriental Pearl Tower . Those interested in learned more about the history of this region will find Qibao Historical Town to be a great destination. China celebrates numerous festivals throughout the year, and Shanghai is definitely at the center of most of them. Travelers who want to experience these stunning displays of Chinese arts and culture are well advised to plan their arrival accordingly. Of course traveling to this region during the Chinese New year will be a special challenge, as everything will be at heightened state of excitement and chaos. Getting around Shanghai is easy and affordable as options include the Shanghai metro and affordable taxis. When traveling through the older parts of the city, the best option would be to travel on foot. Shanghai is a dazzling city with an exciting mix of the old and new in one of the most populated regions in the world. There’s much more to see and learn about Shanghai, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.
